::: {.question}

**Timing of Equity Issuance Under Asymmetric Information**

```{r}
#| eval: true
#| results: asis
#| echo: false
#| warning: false

set.seed(908)
library(webexercises)
library(knitr)

true_value_today  <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 210, sd = 6), 2)
true_value_future <- true_value_today + round(rnorm(1, mean = 5, sd = 5), 2)

market_belief_today  <- round(true_value_today - runif(1, 15, 40), 2)
market_belief_future <- round(true_value_future - runif(1, 10, 25), 2)

shares <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 12, sd = 1), 2)

price_today  <- round(market_belief_today  / shares, 2)
price_future <- round(market_belief_future / shares, 2)

capital_needed <- round(rnorm(1, mean = 30, sd = 3), 2)

shares_today  <- round(capital_needed / price_today, 2)
shares_future <- round(capital_needed / price_future, 2)
```

A firm currently has `r shares`M shares. True firm value today is `r true_value_today`M, but the market believes it is only `r market_belief_today`M. In six months, the true value will be `r true_value_future`M, but markets will believe it is `r market_belief_future`M.

The firm needs to raise `r capital_needed`M and is considering issuing equity today or in six months.

Compute:

- (a) share price today
- (b) share price in six months
- (c) shares issued today
- (d) shares issued in six months
